channel.title: math.SG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Density of fibers for the filtered Fukaya category of $T^*N$
item.description: arXiv:2602.21759v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We answer a question of Biran and Cornea about the density of iterated cones of fibers in the Fukaya category of a cotangent bundle. We prove that indeed if we take a dense set of basepoints, the iterated cones of the cotangent fibres are dense in the Filtered Fukaya category.
item.dc:creator: St\'ephane Guillermou, Claude Viterbo, Bingyu Zhang

item.title: A \v{C}ech--Stokes Pushout Groupoid: a Log/Kummer Betti Presenter for Stokes Torsors
item.description: arXiv:2602.21304v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Let $X$ be a complex manifold and let $D\subset X$ be a simple normal crossings divisor. Fix a Kummer level $n\ge 1$ and an irregular type $\Phi$ along $D$, and consider the logarithmic Betti boundary $X^{\log}_n$ (the level-$n$ Kato--Nakayama space). We construct a strictly $1$-categorical, cover-based Betti presenter for Stokes torsors by building a small strict \v{C}ech--Stokes collar groupoid on a punctured logarithmic collar of $D$, together with a canonical projection $\pi$ to the underlying sector \v{C}ech groupoid. The central observation is that the appropriate collar Stokes moduli is the groupoid of strict functorial sections $\operatorname{Sec}(\pi)$ (equivalently, $\mathrm{St}_{\Phi}$-torsors on the sector cover), yielding a fully explicit presenter that remains small and strictly functorial. We then glue the collar presenter to the ordinary \v{C}ech presenter of $U:=X\setminus D$ through a strict diagram of small groupoids and an explicit $2$-pushout presenter $G_{\Phi,n}$. We prove that global Stokes objects, defined intrinsically as a $2$-fiber product, are computed by a strict torsorial gluing problem, i.e.\ by Stokes-corrected torsorial representations of $G_{\Phi,n}$. In arbitrary SNC depth we solve the local corner presentation problem by an explicit chamber-complex model on the angular torus: Stokes torsors are nonabelian cocycles on the $1$-skeleton with relations read off from $2$-cells. The overall construction is canonical up to Morita equivalence with a contractible space of identifications (invariant under stratified subdivision), and it is compatible with Kummer descent along all normal crossings strata via $(\mu_n)^k$-equivariant local models and descent to homotopy fixed points.
item.dc:creator: Mauricio Corr\^ea

item.title: Symplectic higher Auslander correspondence for type A
item.description: arXiv:2311.16859v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We prove that the Fukaya-Seidel categories of a certain family of singularities on $\mathbb{C}^d$ are equivalent to the perfect derived categories of higher Auslander algebras of Dynkin type A. We relate these to the Fukaya-Seidel categories of Brieskorn-Pham singularities and to the partially wrapped Fukaya categories considered by Dyckerhoff-Jasso-Lekili. We provide a symplectic interpretation to higher Auslander correspondence of type A in terms of Fukaya-Seidel categories of Lefschetz fibrations.
item.dc:creator: Ilaria Di Dedda

item.title: Periodic orbits of non-degenerate lacunary contact forms on prequantization bundles
item.description: arXiv:2406.08462v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: A non-degenerate contact form is lacunary if the indexes of every contractible periodic Reeb orbit have the same parity. To the best of our knowledge, every contact form with finitely many periodic orbits known so far is non-degenerate and lacunary. We show that every non-degenerate lacunary contact form on a suitable prequantization of a closed symplectic manifold $B$ has precisely $r_B$ contractible closed orbits, where $r_B=\dim \mathrm{H}_*(B;{\mathbb Q})$. Examples of such prequantizations include the standard contact sphere, the unit cosphere bundle of a compact rank one symmetric space (CROSS) and many others. We also consider some prequantizations of orbifolds, like lens spaces and the unit cosphere bundle of lens spaces, and obtain multiplicity results for these prequantizations.
item.dc:creator: Miguel Abreu, Leonardo Macarini
